bibl.title: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, February 25, 1940

div1.p: Moran offers to make hotel reservations for Hench, but must hear from him soon.

div1.head: Letter from John J. Moran to Philip Showalter Hench, February 25, 1940
div1.opener:
COMPAÑIA SUNOCO DE CUBA, S.A.
SUBSIDIARIA DE
SUN OIL COMPANY
SUN OILS
AVENIDA MENOCAL NOS. 455-457
HABANA,
(Sunday) Feb. 25, 1940.
CABLE Y}
“SUNOCO”
TELEGRAFO}
CLAVE: BENTLEY
TELEFONO U-6148
SUNOCO
DESTILADO AL MERCURIO
AIR MAIL
Dr. Philip S. Hench,
MAYO CLINIC,
Rochester, Minn.
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Just a few hurried lines to assure you that my failure
to write to you is not due to any lack of enthusiasm on my part
in the matter about which I have written volumes to you in the
past two years. In Cuba, it is always one d----- thing after
another. Just when we arrive at a solution of something trouble-
some, another one is born. Will let details await your arrival
here.

Hotels here are crowded to capacity, especially the best
ones. That being the case, please let me know if Mrs. Hench is
coming along with you and more or less amount you would set as a
limit for a room. Meals will not be expensive. The NATIONAL,
the SEVILLA-BILTMORE and the HOTEL PRESIDENTE demand $12.00 per
day for double rooms, * that is to say for couples. There are a
number of less pretentious ones, clean and comfortable, at lower
prices. PLEASE LET ME HEAR FROM YOU PROMPTLY and I will arrange
for reservation in line with your wishes.
div1.closer:
Sincerely. John J. Moran. JJM:hs
* without meals
